thread.title: National Association of Professional Women Michelle Wuyts-Morales, Recruiting Director, Engel & Völkers, its
thread.title_full: National Association of Professional Women Inducts Michelle Wuyts-Morales, Recruiting Director, Engel & Völkers, Into its VIP Professional Woman of the Year Circle

author: Lisa Mancuso
title: National Association of Professional Women Michelle Wuyts-Morales, Recruiting Director, Engel & Völkers, its
text:
Michelle Wuyts-Morales business. Michelle Jones. “Her knowledge and experience in her industry are valuable assets to her company and community.”
Ms. Wuyts-Morales is a Recruiting Director for Engel & Völkers International Real Estate for the Greater Houston Area. In her role, she is responsible for selecting the perfect candidates who will aid the execution of the company’s goals and initiatives.
“Engel & Völkers is joined by top producing agents who want to be the best and brokerage owners who have made the decision to set the bar higher in their markets. There are more than 5,000 Engel & Völkers professionals around the world dedicated to the values of competence, exclusivity and passion,” said Ms. Wuyts-Morales.
Using her substantial knowledge of Engel & Völkers’ plans and objectives, Ms. Wuyts-Morales develops a strategic recruiting plan to meet the organization’s immediate and long-term needs. She begins her applicant search by researching and contacting community services, colleges, employment agencies, recruiters, media and internet sites, and determines applicant requirements by studying the job description and qualifications.
Ms. Wuyts-Morales’ commitment to matching candidates to the right positions, as well as her exceptional work ethic and leadership qualities, continues to empower her personal and professional growth and define her vital role within the company.
Awards & Accomplishments: Master of Arts, University of North Georgia, Community Counseling; Bachelor of Science, Baylor University, Psychology
